title: In-app production URL link + QR share surface

requirements.summary: Expose the live production URL in the UI as a copyable link, sourced from a single configurable frontend location.
acceptanceCriteria: The app is deployed successfully and loads from a stable production URL.
The production URL is captured in a single configurable place in the frontend (e.g., env/config) rather than hard-coded across multiple components.
Users can view the production URL in the UI and copy it to the clipboard with clear success feedback in English.

file_operations.description: Create a single-source production URL resolver (prefer a build-time env value, otherwise fall back to deriving from the current location) and export a small API used by the rest of the app.

Add a React Query hook that resolves the production URL from frontend/src/config/productionUrl.ts and (when backend connectivity exists) can also read the live link via the existing backend capability getLiveLink().
Add a small clipboard helper for copying text with a safe browser fallback (for environments where navigator.clipboard is unavailable).
Display the production URL as a user-facing text link with a one-click copy action and English success/error feedback (toast).
Extend ImportMetaEnv typing to include a single configurable value for the production URL (e.g., VITE_PRODUCTION_URL) used by frontend/src/config/productionUrl.ts.

requirements.summary: Add a share surface in Settings/About that shows a QR code for the production URL and supports downloading the QR as an image.
acceptanceCriteria: A QR code is rendered in the UI that, when scanned, resolves to the production URL from REQ-1.
The share surface includes a visible text link of the same URL and a one-click copy action.
Users can download/save the QR code as an image file (e.g., PNG) from the browser.
All user-facing labels, buttons, and messages are in English.

file_operations.description: Add a QR code rendering dependency suitable for React (e.g., qrcode.react) to support in-browser QR rendering and canvas export for downloads.

Create a composed share UI card using shadcn-ui components (Card, Button, Input, etc.) that renders a QR code encoding the resolved production URL, provides a visible link + copy action, and supports downloading the QR as a PNG. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Integrate the new share surface into the existing Settings & About page (no new top-level routes), wiring it to the shared production URL hook and adding English labels, copy feedback, and a QR download button.
